org.chronos.chronodb.api.builder.database

Interface ChronoDBBaseBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChronoDBBaseBuilderImpl

    public interface ChronoDBBaseBuilder
    This is the starter interface for building a ChronoDB interface in a fluent API.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ChronoDBChunkedBuilder chunkedDatabase(java.io.File file)
      Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, chunked ChronoDB.
      ChronoDBMapDBBuilder embeddedDatabase(java.io.File directory)
      Deprecated. 
      This is an outdated builder method that now redirects to mapDbDatabase(File). This method will eventually be deleted; prefer the explicit call to mapDbDatabase(File) instead.
      ChronoDBPropertyFileBuilder fromConfiguration(org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration configuration)
      Loads the given Apache Configuration object and assigns it to a builder.
      ChronoDBPropertyFileBuilder fromProperties(java.util.Properties properties)
      Loads the given Properties object and assigns it to a builder.
      ChronoDBPropertyFileBuilder fromPropertiesFile(java.io.File file)
      Loads the given file as a Properties file, and assigns it to a builder.
      ChronoDBPropertyFileBuilder fromPropertiesFile(java.lang.String filePath)
      Loads the given file path as a Properties file, and assigns it to a builder.
      ChronoDBInMemoryBuilder inMemoryDatabase()
      Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate an in-memory ChronoDB.
      ChronoDBJdbcBuilder jdbcDatabase(java.lang.String jdbcConnectionURL)
      Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a ChronoDB that writes its contents to the SQL database at the given JDBC connection URL.
      ChronoDBMapDBBuilder mapDbDatabase(java.io.File file)
      Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, MapDB -based ChronoDB.
      ChronoDBTuplBuilder tuplDatabase(java.io.File file)
      Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, TUPL-based ChronoDB.

    • Method Detail

      • fromPropertiesFile

        ChronoDBPropertyFileBuilder fromPropertiesFile(java.io.File file)
        Loads the given file as a Properties file, and assigns it to a builder.

        For details on the possible configurations, please refer to the configuration API.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to load. Must exist, must be a file, must not be null.
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with, with the properties from the given file loaded. Never null.

      • fromPropertiesFile

        ChronoDBPropertyFileBuilder fromPropertiesFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        Loads the given file path as a Properties file, and assigns it to a builder.

        For details on the possible configurations, please refer to the configuration API.

        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path to load. Must exist, must be a file, must not be null.
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with, with the properties from the given file loaded. Never null.

      • fromConfiguration

        ChronoDBPropertyFileBuilder fromConfiguration(org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration configuration)
        Loads the given Apache Configuration object and assigns it to a builder.

        For details on the possible configurations, please refer to the configuration API.

        Parameters:
        configuration - The configuration data to load. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with, with the properties from the configuration loaded. Never null.

      • fromProperties

        ChronoDBPropertyFileBuilder fromProperties(java.util.Properties properties)
        Loads the given Properties object and assigns it to a builder.

        For details on the possible configurations, please refer to the configuration API.

        Parameters:
        properties - The properties to load. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with, with the given properties loaded. Never null.

      • inMemoryDatabase

        ChronoDBInMemoryBuilder inMemoryDatabase()
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate an in-memory ChronoDB.

        In-memory databases behave in the same way as regular ones, but are not persistent, i.e. their contents will be gone when the JVM shuts down, or the garbage collector reclaims their memory.

        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • embeddedDatabase

        @Deprecated
ChronoDBMapDBBuilder embeddedDatabase(java.io.File directory)
        Deprecated. This is an outdated builder method that now redirects to mapDbDatabase(File). This method will eventually be deleted; prefer the explicit call to mapDbDatabase(File) instead.
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, file-based ChronoDB.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to write the DB data into. Must not be null, must point to a directory (not a file).
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • mapDbDatabase

        ChronoDBMapDBBuilder mapDbDatabase(java.io.File file)
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, MapDB -based ChronoDB.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to write the data into. Must not be null. Must point to an existing, accessible file.
        Returns:
        The new builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • tuplDatabase

        ChronoDBTuplBuilder tuplDatabase(java.io.File file)
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, TUPL-based ChronoDB.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to use as the "base path" for TUPL. All relevant data will be located in files that have the path of the given file as prefix. Must point to an existing, accessible file.
        Returns:
        The new builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • chunkedDatabase

        ChronoDBChunkedBuilder chunkedDatabase(java.io.File file)
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, chunked ChronoDB.

        A chunked ChronoDB organizes the data in chunks and is capable of performing rollover operations that allow for larger histories to be managed effectively.

        Parameters:
        file - The base file where data is stored. Please note that this database backend will create several files and folders next to the given base file; it is recommended to have a folder that contains nothing else than this base file. Must not be null, must point to an existing, accessible file.
        Returns:
        The new builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • jdbcDatabase

        ChronoDBJdbcBuilder jdbcDatabase(java.lang.String jdbcConnectionURL)
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a ChronoDB that writes its contents to the SQL database at the given JDBC connection URL.
        Parameters:
        jdbcConnectionURL - The JDBC connection URL to connect to. Must not be null, must be a valid JDBC URL.
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with. Never null.
